alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Clark; Miami (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 9:12PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CHAMPAIGN, NORTHERN CLARK AND NORTHEASTERN MIAMI COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM EDT... At 911 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near St. Paris, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Troy, Piqua, Urbana, St. Paris, Mechanicsburg, Harmony, Brighton, Christiansburg, North Hampton, Fletcher, South Vienna, Tremont City, Woodstock, Catawba, Casstown, Mutual, Cable, Thackery and Westville. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 60 and 70. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 75 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
